alert.note: Alert for Cheshire; Merrimack; Northern Coos; Northern Grafton; Southern Coos; Southern Grafton; Sullivan; Western And Central Hillsborough (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 10 at 2:39AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IS CANCELLED... The Flood Watch is cancelled for portions of central, northern, and southern New Hampshire, including the following areas, in New Hampshire, Western And Central Hillsborough. In central New Hampshire, Merrimack and Sullivan. In northern New Hampshire, Northern Coos, Northern Grafton, Southern Coos and Southern Grafton. In southern New Hampshire, Cheshire. This flood watch has been replaced by another flood watch that goes through Tuesday morning. && ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. && ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of central, northern, and southern New Hampshire, including the following areas, in New Hampshire, Western And Central Hillsborough. In central New Hampshire, Merrimack and Sullivan. In northern New Hampshire, Northern Coos, Northern Grafton, Southern Coos and Southern Grafton. In southern New Hampshire, Cheshire. * WHEN...Through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Slow moving low pressure will track from the Mid-Atlantic north into New England through tonight. This system will produce lines of slow moving showers and thunderstorms which could produce torrential downpours and lead to flash flooding. The threat is exacerbated by the fact that the ground is already saturated from recent rainfall events. Also, rivers in the area could reach flood stage today or tonight.
info.instruction: You should monitor the latest forecast and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Cheshire; Merrimack; Northern Coos; Northern Grafton; Southern Coos; Southern Grafton; Sullivan; Western And Central Hillsborough
